Description: Moulded pale blue glazed composition shabti with black detail: a fillet, implements and a seed-basket.
Curator's comments: This shabti, together with EA 71198 and EA 67046, likely comes from the 1895-96 Ramesseum excavation directed by Petrie and sponsored by the Egyptian Research Account. Imn-m-hb appears in the list of names attested on shabtis from the site in Quibell’s 1898 publication: The Ramesseum, pl. V. Three probably related examples with a firm provenance from the Ramsesseum excavation are in the collection of the World Museum, Liverpool: 52.55.118, 52.55.143 and 58.32.8.
